meanings.definition: A stone placed at the foot of a grave marker.
meanings.sent1: The footstone marked the end of the grave.
meanings.sent2: Visitors often leave flowers by the footstone of the tombstone.
meanings.sent3: The footstone seemed to be guarding the grave like a loyal sentinel.
meanings.sent4: The footstone stood firm, a silent guardian of the resting place.
meanings.sent5: The footstone, weathered by time, held the memories of those who passed.

meanings.definition: The lowest stone in a building's foundation.
meanings.sent1: The footstone supported the weight of the entire structure.
meanings.sent2: Construction workers carefully placed the footstone to ensure stability.
meanings.sent3: The footstone joked with the other stones about being at the bottom all the time.
meanings.sent4: The footstone, though unseen, was the backbone of the building.
meanings.sent5: The footstone, humble yet crucial, bore the burden of the foundation.
